snippet: By tendering his resignation, the chairman of Parliament temporarily blocked the contentious measure from reaching the president.
abstract: Volodymyr M Lytvyn, the chairman of the Ukrainian Parliament resigns after refusing to sign a contentious bill that would allow local and regional governments to grant official status to Russian and other languages; resignation temporarily blocks the legislation from reaching President Viktor F Yanukovich, who could sign it into law.
lead_paragraph: By tendering his resignation, the chairman of Parliament temporarily blocked the contentious measure from reaching the president.

headline.seo: Top Ukrainian Lawmaker Quits in Protest of Language Bill
headline.main: Ukrainian Official Quits to Protest Russian-Language Bill
headline.print_headline: In Ukraine, Official Quits To Protest Bill On Russian
